elements.title: BP Building
elements.contents: ... that the BP Building (pictured) features Europe's first example of "suspended construction"?

elements.title: Da'ud
elements.contents: ... that Da'ud, the heir apparent of the last Fatimid caliph, spent almost his entire life imprisoned by the succeeding Ayyubid dynasty?

elements.title: Mirabel
elements.contents: ... that Encanto's Mirabel is the first Disney heroine to wear glasses?

elements.title: Siegfried Goldschmidt
elements.contents: ... that Siegfried Goldschmidt translated Kalidasa's epic poem Sêtubandhu from Prakrit into German?

elements.title: his canonization
elements.contents: ... that the headless body of Thomas Aquinas was boiled, possibly in wine, after his canonization?

elements.title: KBIL
elements.contents: ... that after going off the air due to financial issues, the control room of Texas radio station KBIL was set ablaze by an arsonist?

elements.title: Elena Guseva
elements.contents: ... that Elena Guseva's training as a choral conductor helped her analyse the score when playing Polina in Prokofiev's The Gambler at the Vienna State Opera?

elements.title: Squeaky Bean
elements.contents: ... that the vegan-food brand Squeaky Bean produces food that does not contain beans?
